messages.message:
I looked into the traces for different services, sharing my findings below -
• license-service, search service, job-service - There are multiple dangling spans from `db/session/DBSessionImpl.Exec`  with no parent span.  
• model-service - All the spans are from `/model_service.ModelService/HealthCheck` 
• file-service - This has the most amount of dangling spans from `S3Client.Stat` 
• core-platform-service - This has spans from -  `cache/RedisCache.Get` 
Apart from model-service spans all the other services have dangling spans. If these are caused due to missing propagation we should ideally fix them.
I am working on a PR to remove HealthCheck spans from model service and also add ratelimiting to service level traces to protect jaeger from overflowing with dangling spans.
Thanks Puneet! Can you create tickets for these under Core Services so we don't lose track?
@mfichman Is there an EPIC I should use to add these tickets under?
No, you can file them individually.
And assign them to me for now!
Created a ticket to track this - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-4722
